ratings.rComments: The course itself if a lot of material, but you are evaluated in such a way that it is extremely easy to get an A. The answers to quizzes and tests can be found on Quizlet or the online textbook resource. As long as you know how to memorize, it is easy to do well, but you will not really learn any material.

This class was only offered as a fully online class for the semester. Roughly 78% of your total grade will be from conceptual quizzes and exams. The numerical quizzes are for grades and your own learning (not covered on the exam). Be prepared to collaborate with others to learn everything for the exam.

The course is more difficult because of how its run rather than the material itself.  He is zero help.  It's not the easy A everyone expects when taking an online course.  You don't actually learn any of the material.

It's not that he's a bad teacher; he's not a teacher at all. Absolutely no instruction whatsoever. This experience combined with the business school's attitude toward minors led me to drop the entire program. I can only assume this man is someone's brother-in-law.

Worst course taken by far. Gives zero feedback to students and doesn't understand the concepts himself. I tried to set up a meeting with him but he was too lazy to meet me in person and instead asked me to communicate through email. Avoid. At. All. Cost.

He's the worst professor I've ever had. His lectures have no structure or content but go anyway because he has "pop quizzes" for a few extra credit points. You need the book to pass the quizzes online and exams in class. Only reason I survived this course was because I had friends in the class so we all worked together on a weekly basis.

Horrendous professor. Showing up at his lectures is a COMPLETE waste of time as he does nothing but babble inaudibly. I showed up to all his lectures just to see if they would improve but they never did. If you HAVE to take his class, like I did, be prepared to teach yourself most of the material because this guy is utterly useless as a teacher.

Ruined my interest in accounting, I wish I could have learned the material from a different professor to see if the material would have been explained better. Learning from the book it wasn't too terribly difficult material but the professor was just so vague about what was included on tests and how to prepare and reach success in the course

Disappointed that the business department has this professor teaching all of the business minor students,a disservice to them. This class was 1 lecture a week and the rest online videos. Word of advice, I found the textbook the most useful resource. Silhan voice is difficult to understand and spends little time teaching for a 80 minute lecture.

Unfortunately, this man is the only professor for Accy 200 (a mandatory class for BUS minor students). Silhan is an ineffective teacher in the fact that his lectures are meaningless and has a panic attack if someone sits the wrong way during a test. Don't let him make you dislike ACCY just because of his poor teaching methods

Actually the worst instructor ever. First he cuts down on meetings per week from 2 to 1, because he wanted to do a "blended" online and in-person class, which is fine. Lecture's supposed to be 1.25 hours. He's supposed to teach, then give a quiz for EC. He babbles for about 15 minutes, if that, gives the quiz, and we're done with lecture.

The worst, most ineffective teacher I have ever had in college. Material is not difficult, but he doesn't know how to teach, how to write a quiz, or how to guide you to success. Save yourself the frustration and take the class with someone else.

He's disorganized and not a very effective teacher, the grade boundaries are generous though. Regularly studying for the quizzes would make sure you're prepared for the exams (quizzes and exams differ vastly though) I did learn the basics of accy though this being my first accy class (part of biz minor) but wouldn't wanna be taught by him again :/

Silhan does not know how to teach, and his course is relatively useless; I got a 94, 75, and 56 on the exams in that order; going to office hours is really helpful, much easier to learn from the TA's than Silhan. Overall, with the extra credit, it should be easy to get a B without trying too terribly hard.

The problem is this class is useless.  I really learned nothing about Accy and wasn't interested in doing so.  Not much work... and i think that's why i didn't do well.  No review. review sessions are a joke.  It's a useless class.  Just make sure to go to lecture and read though and you should be able to get a b or better

This man is smart. However, his ability to teach what he knows is minimal at best. He teaches a certain way to let you learn the quizzes, but the exams have nothing to do with it. They are all over general information instead of specifics. Since this is 85 percent of your grade, very difficult go do well.
Not terrible, but not fun by any means. He can be entertaining. Little tough on quizzes and tests, but come to class, get extra credit, and you should be ok.

As other people said, he is definitely not a good professor. He can't explain the materials clearly, and sometimes makes it much harder than it really is. Classes are boring and nonsense. But he has a weird grading system that people may end up with good grades.
Awful teacher like the others say.  He rushes through material way too quickly.

39% of the class got at least an A and 66% got at least a B. I don't know why people are griping about ACCY 200 being so hard. Go to lecture and you get plenty of extra credit points. You shouldn't get low quiz scores as a result. Don't listen to most of the comments here. They are just stupid people from the 30% of the class.
This class is bs

By far, this is the worst prof, i've ever had, his lecture slides are useless and book is pretty much non-sense too. the only reason to attend to the lecture is for bonus point. he tells you what is not going to be on the exam. so, materials are very broad. avoid this class, or make this a credit/no credit course if possible!!

Accy 200 is not a blow-off, true, but with a decent amount of effort and the right study habits (I.E. read the online guides, do the practice quizzes, true-false etc.) a B is almost guaranteed, and from experience an A is certainly achievable. You'll learn a lot, although some of it might seem pointless. Silhan seems crazy but he's an alright guy.

He is the worst teacher I have ever had in my entire life. Never thought that I would study for 30 hours, do all the work and go to class but still not understand what he is talking about on exams. Doesnt answer questions that pertain to the wording of a question either. I think he is high on drugs when he teachs because its babbling nonsense.

This guy somehow slipped through the cracks and got a job here. No idea how this man is employed, especially at university where accounting is one of their strengths. Easily the most incompetent teacher I have ever had. His power points are completely useless. He tests more on random book vocabulary rather than any type of rel accounting.

He's is terrible at teaching, helping you understand the material, and the slides are so broad, you might as well not even look at them. I hate this class. I'm used to getting A's at this university, but I don't think I'll even get a B in this class. It sucks because it's a requirement for the Business minor. UGH!

Won't help you if you have a question. His slides are a crazy maze of arrows and boxes. Quizzes are super confusing. The only hope you have for a decent grade is to understand the main concepts and do the practice questions available through the textbook link (which he uses on the exams word for word).

Silhan is tough.  He provides very little structure and lacks the personality and people skills to effectively teach the material.  Seems like a nice enough guy.  Make sure to attend lectures for bonus points, and take advantage of the textbook website.

1. go to class, extra credit will guarantee you an A. 2. to study for exams take the practice quizzes on compass, if you know these questions you'll get at least a B on the exam without ever even opening the book.

By far the worst teacher I've ever had!!! He is a very rude man who would sometimes criticize students for asking a question that seemed obvious to him. Refuses to answer questions and has disorganized lectures. His class is hands down the worst experience in college i've had. this class is more shameful and disappointing than the chief being gone.

The only reason to go to class is for pop quizzes, which gets you extra bonus points because the man cannot teach at all. Incredibly hard to understand; refuses to answer questions of any sort on the exam; disorganized; rambles; in short...avoid him.

I share the same opinion with the majority of students here. He has no ability to teach and you can only learn by reading the book. Going to TA's office hours helps a lot, too. Lectures are boring and unorganized. He often stops the class to talk about random things that have nothing to do with the class. If you have the chance to avoid him, don't

TERRIBLE TEACHER! makes the class WAY harder than it acutally is. the subject itself isn't terrible, but he makes u feel dumb and rushes thru lectures assuming everyone is a business major. if u knew any accy before the class, good for you, but if ur learning it for the first time (which u probably are) FORGET IT!  i absolutely hate this man!!!!!!!
Nice guy, passionate about what he does, and very approachable and easy to talk to.

Definitely going with the general public opinion here.  I don't know how he got to be a professor here; he may know accy, but he sure as hell can't teach it.  The PP slides have so many arrows and bubbles that's it's pretty much incomprehensible.  The only reason to go to class is for "pop" quizzes every day, which gives you an extra % point or two

Worst part of class is 8am.  I would still recommend going though as there are often bonus pop quizes worth a couple points. There will occasionaly be charts that it is best to just memorize even if you don't understand as it will be on the tests in exact same form.  Overall accy is a lot of common sense, if you are not a dumbass you should get it.

Kind of a joke. If you've ever seen any bookkeeping, the first 1/3 of class is review. Lecture was BORING but easy if you actually go.  Bonus pop quizzes every class period were nice. Likes to ramble a lot tho and talk about the class structure and grades (and for some reason hospitatlity majors) which gets annoying.  Made us stay on the snow day!

This class is also known as BADM 432. (Intro to MIS). This teacher is by far the WORST TEACHER in the Universes. He has hardly any empathy, and when he does (if you count it as empathy), he starts to get mad or cry in the classroom. He walked out on our class once which is ridiculous. The things he teaches also doesn't make sense. He FAVORS student
More boring than death.

I actually did better on the tests when I DIDN'T go to class.  How did this guy manage to become a professor?  Once a student asked him to clarify an example, and when he wasn't able to, he ended up dropping the subject altogether.
He was alright I guess for a business class.

Explanations are incoherent, his demeanor is degrading towards students, and he'd be lost without the textbook.  He may understand accounting but he's utterly incapable of teaching it.  Avoid if you can, but if it's required for you like it was for me, I'm truly sorry.  You're in for a rough ride.

Everytime he'd tried to explain something, it only made it worse.  In fact, he'd review for the exam by telling you what was NOT on the exam.  I have never had a teacher this bad in my whole educational career.
No Comments
This man definitley needs to learn how to teach without using the aid of just the textbook.  If he would realize that he is not helping too many students, he could see his job is meaningless.
Only professor I've ever wanted to see get punched.
No Comments

This guy is seriously the worst professor (if you can even call him that) I've ever had.  Please do yourself a favor and avoid this guy.  Everyone I know that has had him, can't stand the guy.  The whole class is pure BS.
You gotta jot down each word he says.  An  a  cant be substituted for a  the  in the exams.
Worst ever Prof.  Yells/cries/unclear... AVOID IF YOU CAN!
